titleInfo.title: Letter from Benjamin Jervis, East India Company Resident at Bushere [Bushire], to Charles Crommelin, President and Governor at Bombay

mods.abstract: *The letter is dated 23 December 1765, but it is almost certain that this is a mistake and should be 1764.The letter discusses the state of trade and expresses the hope that things will improve once the merchants from Corasoon [Khor훮s훮n] arrive and more cloth comes from Bombay. There is an update on the situation between Carem Caun [Karim Khan] and Meer Mahanna [M카r Muhanna], with news that former is at Shustar [Sh큰shtar] and will soon reach Bunderick [Bandar Rig]. Also discussed is the difficulty of using British weight systems in Bushire and the relevance of Article VI of the grants given to the Company by Sadoo Caun [Sadiq Khan] in 1763.
